metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5192 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
When using the local_batch client from salt-api in SaltStack Salt before2015.8.13, 2016.3.x before 2016.3.5, and 2016.11.x before 2016.11.2,external authentication is not respected, enabling all authentication to bebypassed.The LocalClient.cmd_batch() method client does not accept external_authcredentials and so access to it from salt-api has been removed fornow. This vulnerability allows code execution for already-authenticatedusers and is only in effect when running salt-api as the root user.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

salt-api - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-cloud - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-common - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-master - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-minion - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-proxy - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-ssh - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
salt-syndic - 2017.7.4+dfsg1-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: salt package in esm-apps/bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2017.7.4+dfsg1-1').
